description: Borrowed from Latin tegula (“a tile”), from tegō (“to cover”). Doublet of tile.

entries.meaning: (entomology) A small sclerite situated above the base of the costal vein in the wings of various insects, and attached to the anterolateral portion of the mesonotum.
(archaeology) A flat Roman roof tile with raised edges, joined together by an imbrex.
(malacology) Any sea snail in the genus Tegula.
